intro: Homalanthus deltoideus, commonly known as the delta spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive deltoid shape, giving it its common name. The flowers are small and clustered, with colorful bracts that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
